Record.ClassificationPath: Virus Diseases/Slow Virus Diseases/Aleutian Mink Disease
Immune System Diseases/Immunologic Deficiency Syndromes/Phagocyte Bactericidal Dysfunction/Chediak-Higashi Syndrome/Aleutian Mink Disease
Virus Diseases/DNA Virus Infections/Parvoviridae Infections/Aleutian Mink Disease
Record.Description: A slow progressive disease of mink caused by the ALEUTIAN MINK DISEASE VIRUS. It is characterized by poor reproduction, weight loss, autoimmunity, hypergammaglobulinemia, increased susceptibility to bacterial infections, and death from renal failure. The disease occurs in all color types, but mink which are homozygous recessive for the Aleutian gene for light coat color are particularly susceptible.
